Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Ay scripture begins with words of Aesculapius. (Assuming "Aissici commansan" is a misreading and should be "I
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O children, please share this book with you all because it represents the pinnacle of medical science and is dedicated to my partner in life's work; as a result, I believe that she complements me well when dealing with patients through her expository essays, lectures, declarations. (Assuming "Aissici commansan" means something like “Children please share”.)
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	The operation of my master is prostrated in our region and our times, which I deeply regret due to the neglect of his science; he has only left a few sketches in the Ancient Books that I have modified some parts of them, as they contain errors inside closed statements or phrases. (Assuming "Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada" means something like “I mourn for my master’th operation” and taking into account historical context.)
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	It is evident to me that you live up to the order of this treatise in your exposition and declaration as well as conciseness; through these forms, alongside surgical instruments included for description purposes within my declarations (for which I feel necessary), all contributing towards preparation. (Assuming "E es vist a mi" means something like “It is clear to me.”)
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	May be the reason why one does not abandon this small instrument of our time is that art of medicine in these days takes a long path and it requires now to exercise their practitioner through anatomical science which Galiath knew how the parts of the body were made, as well as what caused them together or apart from each other; also knowing about bones, nerves, arteries, veins pulse points, quiet places for blood circulation and organs.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	Even if you wish that your name be mentioned by Hippocrates as a physician' enduring in his work and mostly exceling in the science of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	Might we have already discussed this in the beginning of this book; who does not know that I've said about anatomy here? It is imperative to understand so as not to fall into error and risk being harmed, especially since many such instances exist wherein they are formatted within these sciences.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I saw a learned doctor who had inscribed an apoplectic stroke in the neck of a woman, and some blood vessels in her neck were cut to allow great sanctioned flow into which she died among the most painful ones.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	I saw another doctor who only took care that an enemy stone processed within its state was small and heavy enough to be taken by a team of men; this stone was carried away from the village through one route among several options, so that such man could die three days later after being struck with it.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	I already called for help to remove that one; I saw how the great size of this stone and its position caused by a hernia resulted in her death upon being struck with it.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	I saw another doctor who had been paid by the Duke of our land to perform surgery; he even took care that there was an enslaved black person with him whose leg bone fractured in his backside; and because of this ignorance, he broke the patient's broken limb above the ground without setting a splint on it or applying any pressure.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And when the patient has decided on his desire, he will be dislocated according to their wishes and locked in place by some means during certain days and commanded that we loosen him; so as soon as the hernia is coming out through the umbilicus opening it leads us into a loss.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And then you called him to lie down, and prepared to loosen the ligature, which brought about calmness and ended our sufferings from pains as well.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, since the wound was already confirmed on his limb, we could not prevent that from happening and thus did not remove it to allow for healing before being attacked by humors again in the abdomen.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And another doctor pierced him with an appendicitis cautery and punctured it on some other days until the focus of disease became manifest in his abdomen leading us to seek divine intervention, as he is now possessed by evil spirits!
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	This causes the head of our humors to be polluted with melancholy due to cold; we could not bring him back completely but only those members that had been previously afflicted by it!
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	Therefore, for this reason you should devise two kinds of treatments: one is the work related to health that benefits him and another in which he will be harmed if we make major decisions! This statement indicates a dilemma faced by physicians treating such complex conditions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	Even you have already been filled with water in all parts of this book where opposing actions take place to counteract errors and fears; therefore it is necessary for you to guard the water and use it, so that your folds will not be spoiled by silence or deception.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	So take up your arms with solicitude and protection, and their illness shall be healed and sealed shut.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way through God's grace lost for salvation and blessed succession; heal those illnesses that are difficult to cure, place your arms in water so that you will not suffer from thirst or fear due to lack of faith: perhaps they remain as a part of your glory, but at least here with us in the monastery.

Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	And describes those who are healthy from that puncture and the sick as well in which circumstances it is forbidden to perform this type of procedure; elaborating on its benefits for certain individuals while outlining risks or contraindications, particularly emphasizing historical practices with respect to gender.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	So that this is said to be an extensive and complex text in language well known for its subtlety, which was often hidden due to the shame associated with medical knowledge at the time; even now they speak of it widely as a learned work on puncture and ulcer treatments. From these remarks alone one can understand that this subject matter must have been controversial amongst scholars then (as mentioned in their disagreement) – perhaps hinting towards differing philosophical or ethical viewpoints, especially considering potential gender implications of medical knowledge which might be sensitive today as well; and it makes sense why the narrator feels they need only a small part to finish this lengthy discourse.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	So then I tell you that the comfortable cautery will be used throughout all complexities of this or those matters, except for two types: headaches are one such type. These so-terminal complications concern only what is at its own end (i.e., within itself), as they cannot affect other parts externally and return to their original position once the treatment has been applied correctly according to these rules of logic which I am setting forth, for if you do not understand them well enough or follow my instructions properly
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the complex called headaches and dry matter we are disconnected; as for those who believe in these types of dyssery that cautery is beneficial to them, while others oppose such treatment due to its nature being both qualitative (in essence) and quantitative. Since the cause itself has this quality (essence) and dryness, it is appropriate when dealing with malady caused by warm or hot water used in caution that must be dried out before curing can occur effectively as per these logical rules which I am setting forth here; for if one does not understand them well enough or follows my instructions properly.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	Edis that which opposes what he says, who by cauterizing with fire treats the tail and dryness of man'things seen in men's bodies; when you compare a person to wet places around the focus, it is because your body becomes like their water.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And thus he speaks about that person's words, who already experienced some things for discovery in my case.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However I must not return to that which he already exposed and exercised in the capital of cauterization for previous exercises; instead, let us consider human complexity as well as disease disposition within their bodies, including causes and effects associated with those diseases along with any accidents or spontaneous remission.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	However in other contexts, it's not about you being afraid; mainly regarding diseases of humors that are wet and cold, for all doctors agree on these issues and they themselves have no disagreement when deciding to use fire cauterization against those maladies.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	Be wise, sons and daughters; about the secret of healing through fire used for focus (the heart) and its goodness are those who burn with medicine in medical treatments using fire cauterization - since the target is simple at which only one body part will be harmed rather than affecting the rest.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	Medicine may come to the one who has been afflicted in his limbs and forcefully return him to a difficult healing process and leave abruptly, as per their nature or specific intentions for treatment. This sentence seems metapherical with an implication that certain illnesses cannot be easily cured due to the limitations of medical knowledge during medieval times; thus when physicians treat them, they acknowledge these challenges but persist in trying until there is no improvement (or 'absence') as per
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Medicine's focus lies in its sublimation and inherent virtue; it does not merely consume energy but also provides us with knowledge through experiments and long-term studies of the causes for better understanding, hence justifying any excessive speech as per their nature or intended treatment outcomes. This means that medicine is excused from enduring lengthy dialogues because its essence lies in direct action—curing illnesses in people's bodies by expelling harmful substances through a process of purgation, which if elucidated during our conversation today would greatly impress you and demonstrate the philosophical foundation behind this healing art.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	Wise children, let's not argue about the timing for when it is appropriate to perform surgical interventions and take breaks during morning examinations as they are most crucial times in medical training. Letting our disagreements over scheduling detract from these important aspects of education would be foolish given their impact on future healing arts practitioners' skills development.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	Even though cautery is convenient at all times to prevent the wound from getting wet with the fluid used in cauterizing it and mostly when dealing with pain or necessary pains for which we require no delay, so that there's less danger of malicious intent causing minor injuries.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	Therefore do not apply it on your legs or thighs, where water is actually valued over the vulgar and ignorant medical students, so that even for a disease healed by cauterization, its effects are not diminished due to delay caused by people who seek remedies.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	The cause is not due to the water they drink for themselves; here it's cautery that changes medicine and dries out wetness which causes pain, demonstrating how treatments can alter normal bodily functions leading back to discomfort or disease symptoms.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, excessive use of cautery beyond medicine for the sake of its perceived value and impact on one's work is undermining their true skill as a physician. It not only risks doing harm to patients but also reflects poorly upon their professional judgment and dedication to healing without reliance on unnecessary interventions like cautery, which should be reserved for specific cases rather than used
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is indeed possible that their malady might return at some point in time due to the complexity of the disease and its location within the body, as well as one's lifestyle choices; additionally, considering what has been prepared on one's tabletop for unnecessary excesses which are then accumulated through consumption or indulgence towards causes related to such ailments. Hence, whether malady treated with cautery remains or if it returns in the form of subtle illness caused by little superfluous elements and wetness might lead not just to physical but also psychological suffering; possible is that this pain may even turn into joyful experiences within one's soul through proper dental care for such issues as aches and symptoms related to these causes. It suggests a holistic approach where lifestyle changes, moderation in consumption of potentially harmful substances (which here refers metaphorically), dietary choices that include food with healing properties ("food" could refer both literally to nutrition or figuratively as sustenance for the soul and spirit), along with appropriate medical interventions like dental care, are key in managing one's health. The overall message conveys a call towards self-awareness about personal habits that may affect wellness (excesses symbolized by "superfluous elements") which not only cause physical harm but could potentially lead to spiritual or emotional suffering if neglected, underscoring the interconnected nature of body and soul health.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	Even though it is vulgar speech that the cautioners are their medicine remedies, and this language used by us directly opposes water which we hear but don't understand in order to avoid considering as healing or treatment purposes of medicines nor other causes for such ailments.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	However, the cause is contrary to water; and our understanding that cautioners are medicine remedies only when we administer treatment methods for certain illnesses with such medicines which do not grant healing themselves but instead create a need in one's body at midnight. This mysterious condition then prompts homem cauterist to apply the method, and it is believed that this action leads directly to healing related to water during its phase of absence.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges. E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia. E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	Edisor that the site of application for cautioners does not hurt when applied without being absolute hot; and yes, you already have water ready to apply it with a pointed object (cautery), which is better than iron tools they used before – even prepared by hand! Nonetheless, if applying on the ears' surface, this must be declared according to how much one wants for its warmth. Preparation should also include receiving fregor; and when igniting at that spot (ear), care must be taken so as not to damage any layer of tissue there due to occupation by fire.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	Per aqua è fatta la punizione del ferro; noi lo possiamo gettare in una pozza, per essere poi rimossi dal corpo ed operati di nuovo (aqua est iudicium ferris).

Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	The first capitalized term refers back to an earlier chapter on punishment: This caustification confers upon moisture and cold for the accident of which you give cause through drink or sexual intercourse; it is caused by various kinds of fluid discharges, also called diarrhea in this context (aqua est iudicium ferris) are there for those who wish to delve further.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	Learning of this cauterization form is as follows: That first time you commanded the malady to be expelled through self-mending medicine, for three or four nights at a stretch, depending on what' end goal requires and how old he/she gets along with his customary habits.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu. E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And you have opened your hand'selves in accordance with their wish, and placed our footselves over the forehead between them. The Capitol XIII deals extensively with ancient medical practices focusing heavily upon treating diseases using organic matter obtained from animals (especially those relatable to our physiological needs), such as tear substances for lacrimal puncturing procedures or bone fusion treatments via cauterization. It also illustrates the continued importance and evolution of these practices into modern times, showing that even in medieval times, humans were continuously learning from nature around them by extracting potentially beneficial elements to apply toward healing purposes. This text likely offers an intriguing insight into our historical connection with animals for survival needs while simultaneously examining the medical advancements and techniques used throughout history.

De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	The treatment of hip dislocation involves reduction, often with the assistance of a pointed instrument known as cautery. If necessary, this process is carefully executed on the patient's thigh
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When mucous membranes are expelled from the hip joint area and caused by its contents as well as local factors of their environment; this is called a prolapsed disc, where one hernia bulges out more over the other when compared to them. A common name for such condition used in practice is "slipped disk." (The term slipped or ruptured disk has been historically misleading because it implies that part of an intervertebral disc protrudes into and damages nearby nerve tissue, which rarely occurs.)
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	The location where the hip dislocation is reduced in a supine position (lying face upward). This approach provides optimal access to perform reduction maneuvers with gravity assisting, aiming for minimal trauma

This technique emphasizes careful handling during reduction to minimize complications such as avascular necrosis or heterotopic ossification, which are serious potential consequences when mismanaged dislocations occur. The aim is not only immediate relief but also long-term structural integrity and function of the hip joint, reducing pain without further damage through medical trauma reduction methods (closed reduction).

De cauterizacio de corrodent.	From burning with an acidic substance called caustics, or from a similar agent like acids that cause burn

Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda. E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if one is not Christianized (i.e., converted), or instead wanders constantly in the surface of the body mostly on the limbs and feet, as long as you nourish that with water cauldrons along with those applied directly to it using herbal concoctions; this method also covers situations where one suffers from erysipelas (bacterial skin infection), or when a foreign object such as glass enters the wound. After removing these, wrap only enough of that moist cauldron around and rest your hand on top with compression to secure it for at least 24 hours; ensure this is done carefully not to damage any nearby tendons near the joint being treated (as they are mentioned 'mara' in medieval medical texts). Then pour a little bit water from the cauldrone over that moist bandage, wrap your hand around and gently roll on top of it for compression; continue this action repeatedly. Once wrapped securely with wax thread sealed at its edges near the joint to be treated (this is done meticulously in medieval practices), wait until a slight swelling appears after an hour due to inflammation caused by irrigating that area, and remove carefully as not to cause further injury; continue gently massaging it. The process described here outlines complex wound care techniques from the past which included specific actions for different types of injuries or infections based on humoral theories prevailing during medieval times.

Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When a patient's hand is discharging pus from festering abscesses caused by contaminated thick substances, first cleanse and then treat the entire lesion with complete thermal debridement at its core or periphery; focus on removing black dirt directly if present, proceed slowly to thoroughly extract foreign material through meticulous cauterization techniques that involve direct application of heat (like a metal implement), gradual dissolution strategies over extended periods for stubborn necrotic tissue in smaller vessels within the lesion (intravascular or "lentecular" debridement). Ensure to maintain proper hygiene during this delicate process.

De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	For the purpose of making a wound caused by bleeding during surgery to be closed with an incision made using scalpel (or, more broadly and metaphorically: for stitching up injuries or addressing
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Sometimes troops are endured who use the scalpel to make an incision of pregnancy that must be removed either by means of a vacuum aspiration or through small incisions and cauterizations on the limb, after which it seems difficult for any woman remain.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	So that when an accident occurs to you or your spouse (or more metaphorically: in cases of domestic violence), the hernia is returned into its place by means of a scalpel and then stopped over there where it was first opened, so as not for any reason come out.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And then the small and strong caustic substances are paused over them by number of points (or 'motics' in this text), blown upon which must be hot or sparks from metal, to heal those areas that have been treated with these methods so far as I understand.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	E assigns to them either small or large pieces of land and the captives in whose artery it is broken off by sword/dagger-like action taken without leaving traces on that vein, for which reason you should cauterize him so he becomes abscised and his wound restricted.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	If the wound is expelled from the orifice of the artery when you remove his said limb and extingrande it for cautioner purposes, then immediately take another cautery cutaneously prepared at that point in focus, hence not ceasing to apply something else inside until the wounded man's body is restricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	Watch that you do not burn this nerve and have it retaliate against the other malevolence or harmful intent of others toward him.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	When blood flows from the wound due to an open artery, it becomes impossible in these constricted cases for that body part's restriction of said injury within them (except when using a cautery like we have mentioned before). Mostly so if the artery is large; then among four ways: either apply such cautioner again as discussed earlier or remove it without removing, which occurs naturally. When removed extremities are burned and thus wound restricted, this applies to other injuries too. Either attach a ligature of flesh over that spot for forceful compression if the artery is not extirpated yet; alternatively when extracted its ends will be burnt off thereby restricting said injury as well—this also pertains to others’ similar wounds then, likewise treated with medicines whose virtue lies in restraining such injuries and should have short-term effectiveness for the body part's constriction. Also use padded braces of compacted straw pressed firmly against it (for reinforced compression).
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	May that person who administerth restriction humbly respect the patient's limbs and confine them in bedding or by positioning causes of harm to avoid discomfort. They do not hurt but care for him/her tenderly, soothing their pain with gentle restraint.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	If you encounter such a person who is neither present nor in the care of his/her doctor, then attend to their bedding as described beforehand and understand that they are not going anywhere because there's no grand departure from one side (the patient) of this struggle; furthermore: do not cause pain above with iron chains or on joints but sponge them in hot frugal water within which will relieve the discomfort, allowing it to subside. If cure is needed due to other treatments that were mentioned beforehand by us and our colleagues for this purpose: do not hesitate!

Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The treatment of water that accumulates in joints is one of four species: it could be mineral or resemble stone like ferrum and vetex, as well as plant-based similar to seseli or bean (ceze), or fluidic akin to water with vinegar solution applied externally. It can also result from the influence by animals such as cats which may purr near joints causing discomfort due to their movements and body temperature changes when they are at rest, often misunderstood in medieval times that led them being associated variously like plant substances or minerals for easing pain
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	E when the stone is in the urethra or another cause similar to those that do not fit nor are agreed upon in the urethra, and you stop it at sunlight' end (after urination), if sometimes one sees a speck of blackish-yellow liquid seeping from there due to this small yet specific bladder inflammation issue called "black bile," then administer its extraction carefully while holding the patient’s hands, and apply forceful rubbing for proper expulsion.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And I pause the circulation of blood in certain parts at some pieces of cloth or wool, and extend my finger to those areas because it is often observed that this helps with these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	If there is not a puncture wound as well (since this passage comes from the part of text dealing with foreign objects in the body), then administer external evacuation through that point using the instrument called surgical cautery, which has such form.
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	Even if there is an opening in the patient' endlessly weeping from pain and agony (a compound metaphor describing chronic gout), do so with great care, otherwise treat as follows: administer treatment cautiously by means of gentle or double dilute leeches.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	So, if there is not an opening (representing joint effusion or damage), then proceed as follows: take out a hollow tube and insert the end into the patient's wrist crevice; securely fasten it inside with hot lime powder mixed in oil mollifying. This way only the tube will be present, not your hands (symbolizing minimally invasive aspiration).
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	Also extract air from the patient's chest to enhance breathing; this way we have also noticed that with continuous drainage of humors (indicating aspiration therapy), there is improvement in their condition. The phrase "tropas veguadas cum aquo" refers to a gradual he
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	So, if there is no opening (representing joint effusion or damage), then proceed as follows: take out small amounts of warm saltwater and apply it to the patient's elbow area; securely fasten a dressing over this point with pressure equal to that on your fingertip. This way hold back some liquid at the end, securing everything in place cautiously (symbolizing hot pack application).
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	So insert that into the wrist crevice to make it easier; also remove moisture from this point (symbolizing post-treatment care and cleaning).
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	Therefore if there is not an opening in all causes that we have mentioned previously, then immediately open such that by doing so it will lead to the development of acute inflammation or spasm. (Note: The sentence structure and vocabulanct appear complex due to potential transcription errors, which are common when dealing with historical texts.)
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	The manner of opening that you should adopt is as follows: You sanction the evil spirit residing in the sphenic vein, and expel it with force following its own customary method to ensure proper removal after completion within this very location; thus producing a tiny fissure on the surface ring of the auricularia hairs revealing the greens' colors beneath. (Note: The terms used seem archaic or specific medical jargon from medieval times, and some liberties were taken with translations to make sense in modern English.)
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	So that the lunar figure-shaped crack will enter into the stone and, once it is dead or inert as determined appropriate by your instrument of choice (i.e., a cautery blade), you can quickly create such fissure with speed for which no harm comes to either patient during recovery when healed; thus allowing us an insightful look at humors balance within the body without resorting to invasive methods or medicinal concoctions, all while emphasizing natural and holistic approaches. (Note: The text implies a form of curative treatment that involves making physical incisions into stones believed by medieval practitioners to have healing properties when interacted with.)
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	If the cause of swelling in your arm is one of fatty humors that you believe and have become inflamed, then administer treatment to alleviate it; otherwise, if you do not obey me or follow my advice for recovery, take a mild cold compress according to this method:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	And administer that liquid of which I shall apply in this wound, with a sharp application from the point at hand, into the affected area where it is inflicted, using no more than what will be sufficient to heal and provide relief; thus ensuring proper treatment without excessive intervention.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	Do not administer the liquid when you think that it is already wet with air from above; pause at times of restfulness and remove any impurities or substances under which the wound dressing lies to prevent infection, as this may hinder extraction if necessary. If a person becomes infected due to unsanitary conditions during treatment, their recovery will be delayed.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	Take that water into the wound-caused by fistula, which enters through contact with food and drink during consumption; fill this container from an acceptable source of coolness (such as flowing water), ensuring it' start flows well before applying to cover the wound where we apply such liquid. Remove any foreign material underne0r the dressings covering that area for healing, maintain cleanliness at all times during treatment; should you find bacteria or infected matter present in this case (due to unsanitary conditions), recovery will be delayed. If there is no pus-filled discharge and it's dry like a cough, sprinkle the wound with fine sand from one end of your body region; otherwise if wet dirt results due to poor hygiene practices during treatment (as described in this passage), let that dirty water flow backward over oneself using feet as paddles and jump on top of it a few times, clapping hands alternately while scraping another's fingers across the surface where liquid has seeped out. This method will promote cleanliness for both patients when they find their clothes covered in dirt during treatment sessions (as suggested by this passage).
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Thus there is never an end to this pain that enters through a bone, so all water becomes like pouring into the wound.-"Donc non cessat aquum in quo penetrarebat per ossum et totam aquam simul fec
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	Thus water seeps through the bone so that you grasp paper or cloth and place one end at the source of light, stretching out the other end within which to ignite a wick.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada,
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	Mays in the extraction of animals entering through that hour-glass if it is a small case then they are quite painful and seemingly ill, as we said in our division; but if it's from large cases causing disturbance to their mind, I administer the extraction of them by instruments and knives, for its cause lies outside all other causes that come through the hour-glass.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	Mays in the extraction of worms born from the auricle (ear), when you heal that person who has said earlier about their sickness and treatment regarding digestion and distillation, provided it does not conflict with your care; furthermore, observe the ear towards the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	Therefore if any worm is found here as a cause, heal that person or those subtle ones present; but if there is no visible cause for the worms, take out through their large abdomen this kind of rod with which it takes on its form.
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	When the subtle extremity enters through the ears according to the quantity which suffering causes; and it sucks them in with a strong pull, making their movements frequently so that they become holes or wormholes - (the implication is of an evil spirit entering via bodily secretions emitted by ear-rubbing during excessive pain).
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	May if you do not obey my instruction, then your body becomes obedient and closed in the circuit of the catheter inserted with a silver syringe as we have said; administer drinks that contain substances which have already been mentioned for treating worms during their treatment course.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	Whether it's your effusion, which is the one where you excrete medical ointments through this very instrument from which these are formed - its shape and form.
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And do that with silver or gold thread on this very instrument from which these are formed - it should have a small loop at the end and be placed underneath.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And so that when they push you back into the cavity of this continence catheter here, it is necessary for such an action to be taken if required.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	If you wish, take the ray and wrap it around your decently-centered foot in a way that oil is poured into the groin's hollow of this urinary aid — here being its shape -, along with some sort of liniment or plant extract from these medicines on which we have spoken about using at this point; place said ray above and forward as it must be done before compressing your foot quickly so that oil is expelled into the cavity whereby worms feel an unpleasant sensation.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And if it is already encased in lead that has been found upon one' end of an instrument, then there will be some small scratches on the focus due to this metal being hot and hard when melted into shape around said point at
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	Beware then that when you distil in the alembic it should not be too hot as some of these herbs do not tolerate heat well and can lose their potency or even degrade, which could render them less effective for medicinal use. It's important to monitor temperature carefully during this process.

De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Concerning the healing properties attributed to these particular essences extracted through our methods, it is essential that we document their effects accur
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	In some occasions the young lambs' bellies were not perforated due to their softness; and in cases involving humans with tender meat inside them or any other content within these vessels—and this matter was sometimes distilled directly from the boiling water of the alembic which did not previously steam, using fractions before reaching a rolling bubble. Occasionally, some were also drawn into the lower chamber below and in parts beyond that point prior to separation; it's essential we note how these distinct conditions can affect our preparations. Furthermore, during winter months when young lamb meat is more tender due to natural factors—however unintended by us for distillation purposes—it may impact not only the extraction method but also possibly alter medicinal properties attributed herein; thus further study into seasonal effects on herbal essences seems prudent. Also, let it be known that while some of these elixirs were collected from steam above in chambers just before turning a rolling bubble—which indicates an early stage where the compounds are most volatile but not as concentrated for
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	When she acquires a cold in her body that does not reveal itself to the mind, it is considered one of the major conditions for difficult healing.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	When she acquires movement in the joint, cover that which you pause with your hand lamp to observe it there and then at this time of day as well.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And when movement seems resistant or difficult, work on that subtle form from which it manifests to understand the cause of this sensation.
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the body part in which it is desired to alleviate pain has one sharp and one non-sharp angle, with interspaced slopes that are neither too steep nor too flat; ensure the bandage made of two layers of linen wool so as not to cause injury or bleeding.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And if the pain relief is by accidental contact with flesh or skin (either in a handbath or directly), then work carefully and subtly on that area, applying gentle yet firm pressure until all of the tissue has been addressed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the pain relief is in the hand area (palm), then apply gentle heat as a small bronze star and place that on the palm; simultaneously placing another one underne0 it to maintain warmth, thereby relieving discomfort by heating these areas of concern.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And then if you have sensed the effect of water that causes diarrhea due to fear or anxiety (the evacuation is caused by an overflowing), it brings pressure upon oneself, and so be careful not to harm the nerves of your hand.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	E arrange the bandage on his cloth second according to the amount of swelling in the foot that you have wrapped with Egyptian embalming oil so much, and keep it for three days or until he feels secure about the consolidation of the wound; apply any other substance as needed over time using fingers 3 times a day while massaging his hand holding hands.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	Mays if acute bleeding occurs, you should submerge the sponge or cloth in hot water that has been cleansed with a cauldron and place it over the artery to compress the blood flow which is called hemorrhage according to the distillation treatise.

De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Of the treatment for asthma which leads to the eyes being affected and how it should progress is described herein.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Asthma leads to the eyes of some people occasionally being wet and others only periodically drying out is discussed herein.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore if you have those two friends who had asthma symptoms in the past and separated them from their reasons for being ill—dissecting these causes as described herein—and place your hand over each area three times, this may aid recovery according to our texts.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	Moreover if bleeding is occurring due to a flow of blood from the patient's body as described in our texts:  
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	E the best caution is for incisions and troops to return when any remaining cause of sickness remains after they have been treated at the focus (the source), so that these causes are not brought back while still hot, as their removal results in permanent healing from such diseases.

Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	The treatment of great distemper that comes into the eyes of hawks.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Movements recurrent in the hawk's eyes caused by something that is assembled to make it grow large and tough within its fortress; through such great growth, they are called motas (likely referring to blotches or spots) because of their appearance.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	Addition of thick moisture into the hawk's eye just below and above, which can lead to certain conditions or symptoms. This might indicate that excessive tearing is a concern in this context as it often suggests
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, in their case you must also ponder whether the growth is occurring not only within that which appears above and below but throughout the whole body of water from where it comes (the eye), for such small causes can lead to big problems; these are often likened to leugyrae or "tricksters.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Then you face that issue (likely the growth or disease in question) associated with its origin from latitude and it's crucial to select one of those origins for simplicity when traveling, while holding onto other aspects if necessary; remove what is once-born/naive and separate what has been born multiple times. This advice seems tailored toward managing the movement (perhaps migration or spread) of a condition across latitudes with specific guidance on treatment approaches consistent with medieval medical understanding.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	Might as well if you don't have the necessary equipment to start your treatment is that I force you to put needles through eyes with few or without any visual protection at all times; thus there will be nothing felt by a patient in such cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the figure is large, then adjust it with stitches; and treat that until healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	But if there's not much of something, it won't come true for the next four years; and that discomfort in his body remains healed and regained life is reborn from within him again (after this period).
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if the growth is declining at the edges of his eye lids' partitions, then open it and reduce that greatness; another one you decide to start infiltration with a needle on this area throughout treatment ensures progress from whole; when done through visual inspection only sensitivity will not be noticed by patient for such cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	Then open the incision with sea water wash and treat that area where there is internal healing contained within it needs to be treated as well, ensuring a holistic approach for recovery (through proper care).

De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	The treatment of acorns in the eye above his belly is a peculiar and symbolic reference, possibly alluding to ancient or folkloric remedies rather than
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquells et accideyso a lor catartz le maymi; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquells.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	Even when they are awake for a while and at times sleeping too, even touch their closed eyes with wet cues that have already been moistened in the bedroom and show an apparent inclination of air entering through nose; so as long as you feel them breath, count ten occurrences within these.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	Even an accident of oppression is found in him who allows the evil spirit to hold his head down at our side and lets them hang dirty rags on his body, making clothes wet with blood from that part where all arthritic humours are concentrated according to their quantity (the number determining how many joints have been infected by these) - let this cloth cover him over the area for which he is being treated and lets it be tied around those parts of his body in full, so as to gather together chalky arthritic humours at the center point of our circle (the most suitable location), preventing them from escaping through an existing fissure into a deeper wound - this crack must not exceed that which occurs during flexion.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	It may be that when you cut the spinal cord throughout its entirety in such a way as to reach the arcanes, then in those days they would process them through an opening according to the form of white grey stone.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore, take those beds on which you have wrapped the patient'tablets around their limbs and sides at various positions for relief to be shuffled back and forth between right hand side and left-hand side until they are disengaged from each other.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	Guard yourself that you do not adjust in the crack, thus ensuring it does not reach down to your heel and thighs while lying therein. Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	The technique of the seam is that you add either continuity or stitching solution with needles like those we use on abdominal sutures, or alternatively, adding this continuity method to your finger and hand fingers so as not to forget while working.

Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	Mays if it is not through an opening we have discussed as causes which lead to such illnesses (of gout), the reason being this tool when made of brass in this shape.
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat. E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	When the evil spirit rises in them, and I guard your neck touch to prevent it from affecting your head or chest by ensuring that they stay above their shoulders so that all harmful substances come out of you through these organs—the stomach and spine.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	However, if the evil spirit that enters them is made of fire (as per its knowledge of the cause's location and it inserts itself into their flesh using an instrument), extracting this element according to the quantity prepared within so as not to hurt themselves too much. This sentence refers again to a medieval understanding where internal afflictions, possibly like purges or vomiting, were thought to expel harmful substances from inside via natural processes such as stomach and spinal functions. The phrase "not too hard" could be interpreted in this context not about causing pain but ensuring the process does not overly stress the body'de systemic equilibrium.'

Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When treated with bloodletting as discussed in the division of curative medicine and not by crucifixion, consider when to place your fingers on the back of the evil spirit's throat at its neck region or where you have purchased an instrument for it which is recommended. This refers again to historical medical practices such as bleeding (phlebotomy), suggesting a belief in balance restoration through bloodletting and using specific tools, likely with spiritual connotations given the context of evil spirits being addressed. The term "evil spirit" indicates that medieval medicine was not just physical but also involved addressing supernatural causes for illnesses.

E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua. Avoid giving him water for a whole day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz. E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	Another method of operation in steam bathing involves holding the patient's head underwater with carbohydrates on it and covering them with a cloth which acts like an envelope for carrying out suction, placing this within a container wherein lies the instrument; moving away from beneath the treatment water while keeping their mouth open at the canula end to ensure no accidental inhalation occurs during steam therapy. The patient's airway is maintained clear with continuous monitoring until they are confident that successful oxygen exchange has been achieved and safe for further procedures if needed. This method enhances congestion relief by promoting mucosal moisture, increasing circulation through heat-sensitive vascular responses without using direct medicinal agents but leveraging the body's natural healing mechanisms during steam exposure to foster improved respiratory function and detoxification.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	If the patient coughs too much or drinks alcohol, and if they consume salted foods and mutton, it is necessary that a physician attend to them urgently because their condition may worsen quickly without proper intervention. In this medieval treatise on symptoms of gout flare-ups during colder periods when the humoral imbalance tends to manifest in extremities like feet or hands due to decreased blood circulation, recommendations were provided for immediate medical attention and specific dietary measures which include avoiding alcoholic drinks altogether. E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	This is the form of the tool with which we thread silk when seen herein depicted in ancient Arabic-influenced manuscripts from al-Andalus. It somewhat resembles forceps but possesses no curves as found commonly, hinting at a distinct design optimized for handling delicate materials like silk without causing damage or straining the textile during intricate embroidery work common among skilled Arabic craftspeople of medieval Spain.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	This tool with which we thread silk has edges shaped like the beak of a bustard (ciconia), resembling an emery board for smoothing out rough spots on our precious fabric when preparing it, and ensuring that any cause does not hinder its passage through this device. This tool was meticulously crafted to ensure seamless thread movement during embroidery of delicate silks, with a serrated edge for precision cutting away from the material without causing snags or tears – an essential skill among Arabic textile artisans who created beautifully detailed tapest

E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio. E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor. So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	So besides these other stitches that are torn when they're crossed and not mended according to their compliment, as well as those placed directly at joints (which become prolonged due to the fluid circulating in them), such a wound becomes an incision if you delay its laceration repair within this member; or it is made of primary members themselves, so that they remain unperforated until fully matured; and with respect to non-maturity issues on males' genitals (wherein the perforation cannot be delayed), then such an incision becomes necessary in its region. This wound will not spontaneously heal unless it is properly treated, but if left untreated as soon as possible after being created, this puncture can cause fistulas or other pathologies that may extend beyond the genital area and remain unsanitized (and hence prolonged) until then.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	So if you know the time of the incision for this wound, and so on when it becomes mature, then do so accordingly to maintain its proper healing process as soon as possible after being created without delaying potential complications such as fistulas or other pathologies that may extend beyond the genital area.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	So if you know that maturation occurs when the pain subsides and fever ceases to be present; as well as a decrease in anger (which is symbolic of inflammation) and pulse rate diminishes while headache symptoms lessen, along with other body swellings. These signs indicate proper healing time for appropriate treatment interventions such as suturing or stitching procedures to be conducted timely after injury, without allowing potential complications like fistulas or infections that may spread beyond the affected area and remain unresolved until then, which can further delay recovery.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia. E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.
