Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu. E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the worm is large and already has sickness causing pustules on it that you should puncture without harming any part of its body which comes out entirely at this time; having removed a portion from outside, then introduce another larger piece within as day goes by along with continuous application of medicinal substances according to the level achieved in healing until there is no more injury. (Translation)
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	Mostly if the malady is due to excessive pleasure or female sexual intercourse, infancy, childhood, old age, wherein animal spirits move towards bodily evacuation and exit through illnesses, which often leads death; therefore operate on these causes immediately.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	1. E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If in the gangrene it is detached one part of the crura or has flattened that which there occurs within the circuit, then cover such with cloth soaked in warm oil and a little vinegar when you touch pans or gravels; this will restore its moisture by tomorrow morning. Then treat his gangrene to keep him clean from inside urine coming out of where it is healing that has become sterile through the mixture used for treatment, which comes into contact with all three aforementioned areas and holds such hands in place as well.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	If acid flow increases during your operation time, administer cold water and agree to use such for moist cloths with which one can place a pad on the area of inflamed blood that is coming out in waves; stop this frequently from where it emerges as long as possible before healing begins.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	If the acid flow continues, cover your regime and treatment with salt; apply these that I recommend in small spots of this booklet to control such places as well. To alleviate inflammation due to continuous acid discharge from gangrene-infected areas: mix a tablespoon each of common salt (sodium chloride) and brown sugar with sufficient warm water for one liter, stirring until the substance becomes like paste. Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs. To prevent further injury during colder seasons when patients may have gangrene due to vascs compression: wrap the affected spots delicately in sterile gauze soaked in a mixture of mustard seed powder and warm oil (olio caliente) for better circulation; frequently change this dressing, particularly if it becomes damp or cold
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	If it is summer and the places are hot, then you should stop bleeding from starting in your extremities when they come into contact with water or oil as well as taking medicinal herbs internally (and externally) if necessary to alleviate pain on that day; also ensure that any corrosive substance that may have caused an ulcer is removed and properly treated.

E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa. E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	Either submerge the wound in Egyptian ointment if present; otherwise immerse it in water and salt. Then apply wet clothes to that area and remove them after a day, allowing those waters to corrode all of which will result in removing such moist skin from thereafter.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	Iterate that wound with Egyptian ointment secondarily and repeatedly if needed, until it becomes comfortable for you to handle, in order that there may not be any remaining cause of such moist skin; as long as the wet swelling is contained within this dressing while being healed.

E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat. However, some women do not have this kind of wounds in the head that affect those who lack moisture; which causes it to be divided on the top of a woman'in her youth and was treated with hard, rough, white stones or pebbles placed firmly over without being able to scratch off. It is crucial first to differentiate between simple overfullness (urinary bladder overflow) versus a more serious condition like retention due to constipation or intestinal obstruction, which can also lead to urine pooling when the pressure from accumulated stool in the colon presses against the bladder. Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols. De curacio de las plaguas.	From the treatments regarding pleurisy (pleural pains).
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	You have already told in the division of healing for diseases what was appropriate to free oneself from them and thus you teach about his own health care according to agreement with these treatments, as well as other related therapies which are also agreed upon by us all together.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	So let it be said that wounds are diverse according to the ways they bleed and on the location where cuts occur, thereby affecting treatment strategies accordingly in medieval times when understanding of blood clotting was quite limited but doctors still tried to categorize based on symptoms observed.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	Therefore it is due to external factors such as stone injections or sharp objects like nails and scissors causing bleeding wounds, but also from blows with clubs, spears, axes which mimic the causes of internal injuries affecting patients similarly. E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra. E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	This is the common method of suturing: a technique where you take out and remove threads (or use them as needed according to their length), then securely fasten this area with one thread; next attach both thigh wires, after which there are four in total for securing. This step requires careful attention due its delicate nature – always prioritize patient comfort while ensuring proper closure of the incision or laceration to promote healing and minimize scarring as much as possible without compromising function. It is important that these wires do not enter through butt cheeks (where applicable), instead securing them between hip bones, especially those parts where fractures have occurred – thus allowing for better support during the healing process while avoiding unnecessary discomfort or potential damage to surrounding tissues due care must be taken when handling these wires. Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn. E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit. E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part. E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen. The generation of this parasite is through the decomposition of certain harmful fluids along with decaying matter, worms and snakes and woodlice in the belly; these vermins reproduce by consuming acidosis alongside their own kind - such as intestinal worms, roundworms from earth (from which humans can be infected) – hookworm larvae that penetrate through skin contact with soil contamin
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	It is feared for its malice, as when it enters the body and ascends to the head—it has reached the brain, from which sudden death ensues; along with this comes a cough that intermittently occurs throughout life in those infected by these motes. These afflictions wander within individuals perpetually following their ingress into the human system via contaminated water or food. And when you want to heal that and extract it, then no need for surgery if not necessary; walk around the affected area with your senses attuned there so as soon as symptoms appear; after this firmly secure what is on top of the lesion and carefully remove all foreign material from underneath without causing further damage.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit. May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio. De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	About diseases caused above illnesses, or about chronic disease of humors excessive and harmful substances being retained within body after treat
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre. Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc. De extraccio de sagetas.	From extraction of salves.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Salves are diverse according to the species and by location on the body's surface where they apply as those with large points or peaks, small ones, concave shapes, hollow textures which make them hard when applied; while some have three angles (for example arnica), others look like leaves in shape.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	As for the ones applied to hands and feet—they are divided into two types: those which follow a concave shape matching that of the brain, spinal cord, heartbeat, spleen (an organ related to blood), lungs, rheumatic joints; as well as their limb-like forms. Therefore when these appear on your fingers and are visible above the wrist bone—which should be taken into account in major applications where this occurs at its deepest point within a body part, if you do not see it there but rather feel an uncomfortable sensation below or between those areas of skin that corresponds to the described shape; then extract and treat these as follows: however, avoid extraction from such salve when death is imminent in this particular location wherein during major applications, especially concerning diseases within joints. Once you find them there without seeing their appearance above your wrist bone, if they are not felt beneath or between the corresponding areas of skin that corresponds to these descriptions; then extract and treat those as follows: but note that when death is imminent in this specific location wherein extraction should be avoided during major applications regarding joint disease.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	Even when the senchals of servants are in their seat, they can cause pain to the body which affects bones and hurts above all because it falls on the brain causing sudden severe headaches; accompanied by scotoma (vision loss), vertigo (dizziness), questions from patients about bodily pains, inflammation and tongue-related problems including spasms and mental confusion. They may also vomit as if suffering a feverish condition due to increased body heat like the warmth of meat cooking in water; humidity appears white on wet skin resembling pols (swelling), patients seem thirsty for blood, leading them astray from their path and destruction follows.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	Therefore if the appearance of these servants arises, so that you avoid treatment and extraction from sickness unless it's outright necessary (if not external).
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	If the malady's servants appear in the chest so that they are next to the right breast and feel like a hard cause pressing therein (instead of being caused by something else); it seems as though its movement is similar to leg shaking, holding hands with someone due to feverishness; sudden fits resembling seizures or convulsions happen in the patient's black slave body which moves and flaps like wings. The illness exhibits restless legs trembling (having difficulty sleeping), squeezing of a limb, palpitations as if heart flutterings occurred; hence you know that death approaches quickly after all these symptoms arise simultaneously from the malady's servants within one individual body.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	E le senchas quando la sageta ha plagiol'il pulmo così che sia essimanto di sanch spumos da lli baaudins si apostegan a la coltura propa del coll, e es muda la color de malu. Es expira sperit granat i demanda atraccio per aquell que fa fregar.

E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	Extracted from another Arabic tale told to the Crested Man in the marketplace where he was hunting for wildlife. E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals. E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz. E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And thus he was called to the curative care of my person with respect to his secret-hunting activities within three days, as per this treatise's guidance in medieval times for treating conditions potentially related to humoral imbalances and ensuring ethical treatment towards others.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then he stopped the secret-hunting of the little thing without resorting to force; and after that, when I asked about my attempt at subtlety with her, she did not feel it in any way either; maybe even felt a slight prick from one thumbtack's head on purpose due to being touched by its extremity. After this event occurred as described hereinabove regarding the little secret-hunting creature and my treatment approach during that medieval era.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And you bind the place where it is inserted and implanted for direct action on internal organs as well as digestion, confirming to me that this location has become my stomach-related area of interest due to its proximity above said cavity which then affects everything in that way.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	However no accident significant occurs at the affected location, and you continue to maintain it within this space for days without accidents; hence that wound becomes well-healed during interim rest periods, which is strengthened by recalling some of these experiences back to me after one day when I feel my stomach returning.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then you pause over the wound and apply acute corrosive medicine for a few days within which focus grew, so that I attempted to touch it again but applied pressure on its delicate end attached to iron (likely referring to an amputation stump). This suggests caution due to potential infection.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses. E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	You have previously set up the fire and focused it on me so I can insert my instruments into you to treat that area without being bothered by pain (as one normally experiences), which has been mitigated due to your skills in managing such matters, allowing us to proceed for a day as necessary. And so, we restore what was treated.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	Clerical doctors ruled that the nasal cartilage is not restored and I have treated it thus; thereby strengthening the joint (as would be done), ensuring complete healing of the disease by its entirety, without recurrence under any cause whatsoever in this place.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	I recommend to you the quality of extracting some humors for which I must pause and rule, meaning something that hasn't been said before; neither have understood those parts of this art nor comprehended their definitions as described in them since they were not known or understandable by me. This relates back to certain elements within our field (of medicine) regarding the extraction of humors with which I do not agree, arguing that these methods are unclear and unknowable based on my knowledge alone without having experienced such practices first-hand nor read about them in detail beyond what is commonly known and understood. The artworks themselves or their definitions were insufficient for me to grasp the full extent of this controversial practice before its time within our medical community.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso. E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	So then I declare that salves are not removed from the body members in which they were fixed, but only through two methods: either by drawing a chain around where it intertwines or by using the opposite force of the other separated piece.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And when it is inserted into the body through a specific location due to infection or abscess formation inside and subsequently drawn out and removed using this method, either by means of inserting an instrument directly within the infected site if feasible (intravenous approach), or otherwise via local incision near that particular member part wherein it was fixed. E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	But if you do not heed the recommended time for treatment when it comes to this condition, I advise that once your health allows (after recuperating), we shall remove what was placed inside of you by placing a cushion underneath and then manually extracting along with its exit path. The removal process will also include pulling out any attachments still present in the wound area for better healing conditions.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada. De fleubotomia de las venas.	The method of performing a vein stripping procedure involves making small incisions in the skin to access and remove varicose
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The method of performing a vein stripping procedure involves making small skin incisions to access and remove varicose or spider-veins, which is typically required for the legs (specifically up to age sixteen). The appropriate tools include hemostats such as Allis forceps; herbs that appear at two temples used medicinally with these instruments called "alhasisain"; and blood vessels in front of both eyes named after a colorless substance commonly known for healing (aspicientz); the selected vein is cleaned on the forehead, while another common facial vessel located above the nose; as well as guidewires that are placed at specific body landmarks: one along the spine and others in various locations around it. Additionally, blood vessels within several genital regions (including lips) are also addressed during this procedure to treat a range of vascorgraphic conditions affecting these areas too often seen among young individuals engaging in sports or sexual activities where such veins can become prominent due to repetitive motion and friction; the tongue's blood vessels, which may be considered cosmetically undesirable for reasons related to professionalism (as they are visible when smiling) but also functional concerns over potential discomfort caused by their dilation during physical exertion or emotional stress. The process is meticulously designed not only aesthetically and hygienically through the precise removal of these vessels in one go, minimizing bleeding risk to patients undergoing this relatively minor form of surgery but also with an eye towards maintaining overall vascular health by eliminating unnecessary pathways within delicate tissues that could contribute over time to systemic circulatory imbalances. E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And stretch the ligature and tighten the veins around that which is strangulated to make it difficult for this disease not to spread by so ensuring its neck constriction; when all parts are healed lay them quietly inside a clean bed, where they will be cured.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the tooth extraction of those veins inflamed and small spots like acne on lips as well as corruption in gums with little pustules or blisters, bad sores and caustic ulcers both inside nostrils and along its boundaries are treated.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident. And then mark it carefully according to its course inside their body starting from these small, dark venous ones and going deeper into them with your finger or needle-like instrument while looking at both sides' veins: one on either side (right labial vein and left uterine vein); this may also be evident in the path of those tiny black vessels. And then draw it carefully according to its inscription starting from inside, as I have shown you so far through an illustration or a visual representation with dark strokes.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas. E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa. E as the surgeon sterilize his own lancet with a few drops of ancient oil properly; and he pauses to mark on one side of that vein (where it branches), placing this left untouched for what will be needed during lancing, so they flee just enough in order not to cut the vein itself. E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	Therefore, by virtue that the surgeon should be firm and agitated in all these causes. (Note: "aquo" is a medieval term for 'by means of', so this sentence implies that any cause requiring surgery must require precision and urgency from the surgeon.)

Even so, the master administers a gapping of oil during the whole surgical procedure in which the patient's veins are kept from bleeding out by doctors and they make toxic alcohol solution while taking sedatives when one is paused on location (the area where an incision was made), for it is subtle and revolves softly once hardened.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	Even if there is a great abscess at the site of lithotomy, it occasionally bursts and mostly for that which does not stay firm but rather moves like what happens when one opens up an artery or where you place your hand over soap in warm water to hold someone' enduring pain. And to which it is customary for sudden fainting spells due to bloodletting, afterward you care for that immediately afterwards with wine infused from barley or millet simple scalded; and take out the soul three times a week at most.

If acute chills accompany fever and the cause is some unsanctioned moist motion—such as inhaling water that contains scented fragrances while bathing or excreting strongly aromatic substances underwater; use of essential oils may help alleviate their discomfort, soothing them to lie on it.

Even if one wants to heal their arm and dissolve their sin according to habitual practice, they need the oil of which cauterization is by chance evacuation; its purpose is mild like warm perspiration that gradually expels little sanctum day after day.

Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent. De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	De ventosacci et quantum humori aliud esse causat hoc dolore in juncturis, ut se haberi docet, lahoras quando apertus sit ipsa
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Windwashes are composed of corn, flax or wool.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	Windwashes are considered painful for two reasons as mentioned by the saying: one is from being scratched and extracted with a sanicle (a purgative herb), while the other involves windwashing itself, which includes such treatment.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	This self-windwash that requires scratching is said according to the ways: either it's done with a knife or similar tools (like fingers), and/or focused beams of light such as sunlight are used for this purpose, implying an exposure treatment. This reflects historical practices where certain types
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	The windwash treatments that are administered through scratching and extraction of sanicle take place at twelve locations on the body, as mentioned in this saying: one where self-windwashed areas are marked with a scarification method; located towards the head—just before reaching below it (assumingly referring to around neck or face area); the left jaw is released first then followed by progressive release starting from the mouth and ending just above the chin. This might also indicate specific points of pressure along these locations for treatment purposes: on teeth, ears; between eyebrows (which refers to a known traditional practice called "eye brow divot"); incisors as well as upper jaw which are typically considered sensitive areas during such treatments. These practices underscore the complexity and localized nature of historical medical procedures related to windwashing within this culture's traditions, involving numerous specific methods and locations on the body for treatment purposes. This illustrates a holistic approach where every part of the individual’thought process in understanding traditional healing modalities that intertwine physical actions with spiritual or symbolic significance. To fully appreciate these customary practices from an anthropological perspective would require delving deeper into their cultural and historical context, as well as examining how such methods fit within modern medical ethics standards.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	Even when the blood rushes from a wound, it does not come directly out of small veins spread throughout the flesh; nor is there any movement through those vessels due to this, even if one goes for an arterial cutdown; and furthermore, blood should not be considered as originating at or near the head' end in such injuries that make all parts evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	If it is necessary due to illness or a continuous cause such as excessive indulgence in rich foods and drinks that provoke wind accumulation within the body at any time during the meal on Fridays, evenings before sunset (whenever this condition arises), then take immediate action.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	If it is necessary due to illness or continuous causes such as overindulgence in rich foods and drinks that provoke wind accumulation within the body at any time during meals on Fridays, evenings before sunset (whenever this condition arises), then take immediate action. Take those individuals for whom it is evident they are subject to excessive coughing due to air escaping from their bodies through a severe and abnormal opening in their throats; also the ones who cause pain when something presses against their face, head, neck, chest, back or belly - holding them firmly. Consider those individuals whose winds seem uncontrollable within themselves as they are prone to excessive sneezing and coughing which disrupt others around them; and also the ones who experience sudden outburst of anger leading their voices become loud during nighttime or at other times, especially when touched on face, head, neck or chest - holding firmly. Take into account those individuals whose winds seem to escape from within causing blurred vision in front eyes with darkness above and below (causing visual impairment); also the ones who find themselves confused because of this; additionally consider others for whom excessive sweating occurs on their forehead or cheeks due to internal humoral imbalance, coupled by dry mouth that makes it difficult swallowing - holding firmly. Don't forget individuals prone to sleepwalking with an increased tendency towards walking outside at night and in public places; also consider those who complain about sudden onset of severe pain while lying down or during exertion – not just joints but muscles as well, indicating intense inflammation. Do not overlook individuals for whom eating becomes a challenge due to the discomfort from accumulated heat within their bodies - often relieving themselves through urgent bowel movements; and also those who experience disturbances in sleep such as waking up at night feeling anxious or stressed, along with complaints of headache. Remember individuals for whom vomiting becomes a frequent occurrence – particularly noting the form it takes: dry retchings where no substance comes out (hollow emesis) - firmly holding them during these episodes; and those who experience nausea when looking at certain sights, sounds

E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias. E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	From that which the complexion is fair and prone to excessive sweating while drinking wine or ale with honey, or sweet cider made from apple seeds, and having an odoriferous substance like mustard between white and black garlic; it is commended for its use of restraint in eating bread and meats. E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And when on feast days, wine is more abundant than food for him.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz. Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si. Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha. E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas. E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the reason for pausing this windpipe over a member is that one should not extend too much heat from the fireplace candle, and pause it there on top of the transverse humerus in the chest area where the airway passes through so that the focal point can be lit up above without combusting part of the patient's torso.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	Even a point should be placed on the member of malady and he/she tells about what we have just said, entering when they breathe in that which is mentioned but do not digest it because this generates steam above such matter, then if there are breaths and no vomiting according to what was told, even a cough becomes dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And as for fire in accordance with its nature, and repeat that if they are unable to digest it.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	And in a case where steam is administered for the treatment of hiccernia (epilepsy), it's placed only on that member without any transverse barrier or trauma and isn’t actually applied but filled with water, which should be poured over just that limb.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the way it works: The larger steam allows for greater absorption of water which can potentially help in treatment or relief as desired by some practitioners' methods during medieval times when these treatments were often more home remedy-based than scientifically validated approaches to care.

Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Sanguisugus is not administered in small members but where it's possible to place steam on the limbs that are smaller due to shortness of height or because they lack teeth, gums, and flesh; also for a nude member with skin covering nose and genitals. E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa. E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	E these are the styles of medieval cannabis, and they have been formed carefully. Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura. Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Capitul Segon": In princip, cuando hi ha fet una cadí que s'ha esborrat i la dignitat d'aquell no restaix per si mate
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	Capitul Segon": In princip, en primera aproximació, una fet que ha subjat un cadí i hi ha perdit la seva posició o dignitat passa per això a deficitar; les causes del mal generalment són diferents dels motors de cada spezia. Per exemple, algunas fracturas semblant escausent directament como dues petites micaques en el cap al fet i no siguen ni rotadesixen o seguiten movimentat amb percussio d'altres espècies; aquestes podrien ser nompat a les spezias de fisura, on la fractura s'ha produït abans que l'humor del fet li ha esborrat i el petit motatzin és una micaque o malformació ambcreimada dins hi. Més com quals estan documentades per aquí en restaixen, altra espècia diferent de les mencionades podria incloure desaprovisions tot fou; aquesta seria un cap a fractura que ha estat esborrat i non reparat fins a hagut. Aquest fet pot obrir la cavitat interior del cap així com sol·litar al petit motatzin lor, incidint el més gran dels humors corporals en aquella zona; per tant aquesta spezia de fractura és nomnanada una fisura latent.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz. E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu. E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	I will now provide an English translation for each line of this medieval medical treatise text while trying my best interpretation given its mixed linguistic influences and slightly archaic style:
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	One method is that you insert the needle into each bone with sharp edges and this is how to do it: Firstly, take a smooth-edged instrument for initial incision. Then administer another inserted tool which consists of only one point less than before; this too forms part of our procedure as follows:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	Sometimes, instead of the second instrument with fewer points, you might also insert more smooth-edged instruments for incision. This alternative method is an option as well:
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	It is essential that you have various instruments for incisions at your disposal; some of which are even smoother than the first tool used less frequently and these consist of tools slightly shorter yet longer ones as well – all made either from iron or hardened steel, representing different points on a person's extremities. These diverse implements serve us according to need herein:
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel. De sermo en dislocacio.	Should a speech be in discordance.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is an injury to one of the joints in their place, so it's forbidden from moving and is required for them to be immobilized; this causes pain above the abdomen and great discomfort. In English: A joint dislocation requires immediate immobilization as movement can exacerbate the condition which often results in acute upper abdominal pain accompanied by significant distress.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	When one is injured by a joint dislocation, immediately perform the necessary steps to reduce it and do not delay that reduction because if you wait too long, the person's localization becomes apparent and affecting their ability for painful relief once more forcefully reduced occurs. In English: If someone suffers from a joint dislocation, promptly undertake measures to realign them back into place without hesitation or unnecessary waiting; otherwise, prolonged immobility will lead to evident signs of distress which can impede the subsequent reduction process due to increased pain upon forced manipulation.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	So I don't believe it should be rushed or stretched out during the reduction process either because frequent movements often bring about muscle spasm and latent pain manifesting themselves suddenly. In English: It is not advisable to hasten nor elongate the treatment period for joint dislocation, as repetitive motions are likely to cause sudden onset of muscle spasms and underlying pains that may resurface after any manipulation attempts

When water causes harm (akin to exposure in some contexts), you should crawl into the hernia cavity and ensure that your body remains inside until recovery; then place their foot gently back where it belongs, immerse both feet in warm water with oil for comfort, which aids reduction. De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	Chapter XXVI. On the reduction of a muscle' extrication or displacement.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	It is known that the muscle can be dislocated in three ways, one of which occurs when it separates from its attachment to bone at an angle or sideways movement. 
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	The second way is that it becomes displaced away from the muscle, and this occurs at an angle or sideways movement - painful when touched but not in terms of bone movements towards behind for shoulder joints nor due to nerve disruptions (neuralgia). 
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	Mostly it is externally displaced and one can feel the separation at joint angles or sideways movements - particularly when bones are thin like in 'leugierem' (fragile) conditions; even more so, if muscle masses have low strength as with some patients. It becomes internally dislocated which poses difficulty due to abnormal motions of body parts. 
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	But let's not ignore the old method of treating such cases with gentle tapping or even binding as was common in some homes - and once a muscle is discovered to be displaced (after all this examination), it should then be reduced back into its proper place. 
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	And now that you've entered the treatment process for a patient who has been overlooked before they came in, let us proceed with their healing or therapy.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	It is well-known when the dislocation occurs at joints and you have to move it back because so that one distinguishes between dislocated muscle and healthy muscle; here I am going through these different manifestations: firstly, in order to make contact with the head of the concave part of a muscle (which is how an avulsed tendon or ligament occurs) you have to move it back carefully. Unfortunately this cannot be reduced at all on its own side and due only to movements will not return there again either.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is a dislocation of either your hand or foot, and you see the bones misaligned without pain, then do not be alarmed. De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	The treatment of the dislocation (likely referring to a joint like shoulder or hip). In simpler terms: This refers to medical procedures aimed
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	The condition described involves difficulty and apparent pain when returning (to the normal position) of a dislocated joint; such injuries are typically treated at all angles but mostly with manual manipulation on both sides - where it is most displaced, behind in this case – and once adjustments have been made to realign the shoulder which no longer causes referred muscle pain due to its concave shape that cannot be folded nor touched without discomfort as previously experienced. In simpler terms: The individual's condition involves difficulty returning a joint (possibly their shoulder) back into place, causing apparent pain; such conditions need immediate medical attention and manual adjustment on all sides where it is most misaligned – in this case at the rear of the body because that’s typically how shoulders dislocate. Once properly aligned or 'set', there won't be referred muscle pains associated with attempting to fold the arm over, which was a symptom before realignment due to concave shape preventing normal movement without causing pain by pressing on certain muscles around it.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And if you have teeth (infection), then reduce the displacement as soon as possible so that it becomes an apesome caustic wound to him, which is difficult in its reduction and does not heal completely; most often when they are at the posterior parts of their bodies due to this dislocation, all other species have bad ones for almost total differences in both displacement type and pain level.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	E the restoration of health when that is possible to reduce it is by extending her limbs both arms and legs as well as positioning themselves over their chest; then apply pressure on the joints between the fingers or thumbs during most sessions, until they return to normal place. When she holds them in this way for extended periods, intermittently applying these techniques while ensuring hands are held firmly at all times can be quite beneficial as well as preventing recurrence of symptoms by maintaining overall body balance and humoral equilibrium through regular physical activity which includes walking daily to improve circulation.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	If the displacement occurs due to weakening of joints near parts like hips or knees, then return that which doubles her own body weight inside while hitting at elbow's bone where tip of hand lies on its surface until she regains normal position with assistance from doctors.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	If the displacement does not respond to reduction techniques used earlier in treatment plan then apply strong extension and motion which are intended both for repositioning of affected joints back into place under professional supervision ensuring no additional trauma is caused during these procedures leading towards complete resolution without further pain or discomfort.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	Because two attendants extended her arm and held it while applying the necessary extension that should not be increased beyond safe limits ensuring patient comfort during these therapeutic interventions which helps in reducing pain sensation by maintaining appropriate position without causing any additional strain or injury.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	Hencefors his arm is rotated all round but ensuring it's wrapped in a long cloth called 'drachm', or bandage which helps immobilizing the injured part and preventing further movement that might worsen condition without causing unnecessary discomfort by restricting circulation through proper wrapping technique as per doctor’s instructions.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	When the doctor touches any joint of his body, anoint that area with some oil so that whatever causes friction in the joint will be reduced and lubricated; also he is to throw it into a strong embrace forcefully until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	Et after the reduction of that body part which is stopped upon that spot on where it has settled with stitching and surplus poultice made from albumen (egg white), and some have found relief by stretching their arm away, rested for several days at a time.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And thus if the joint is formed in that place, then do dislocate it and stretch out its ligament, as well as doing so to that one (joint).
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you know that the joint is not stricken (inflamed or injured), then apply an emplastrum and stretch out its ligament, as well doing so to that one (joint) for several days until it protrudes; after which do dislocate it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	And if one falls ill due to gravity and is in motion (not at rest), the position of that body part needs humectation done with warm baths mixed with gentle frying substances underne0 until it protrudes; or apply pressure over its joint as a fatty cough cavity, binding it tightly after which do leave it on the bones all day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And apply that cautery on the joint and put that one in water; when its urine is present (if it produces any), then rub with warm crude ointment over that joint as a ronhnolinal of motion for one week, repeating this action each day. The second time should be after several days have passed.
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	I am inside of it so that I may be cleansed.

De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Chapter XXVIII: Of the treatment for detachment of bones where it is between the arm and the body at a joint.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	Bones dislocated from the body can be misplaced, and the reduction of such a displacement is light work; it contrasts with other joints except that when bone occurs out at night or in an open wound (apostemat), therefore to place directly on site.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	The reduction of the displacement is done by taking the joint between the body and hernia over a table; then extend that part with your hand or palm placed directly above the joint—and push it back into its original place, so as to return it there.(Doctor'ner)
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	Moreover that it be considered if the palm is already lying on the patient's abdomen; in this case he should extend and reduce his leg over a table, just as with bones or hernia—and also consider whether displacement occurred beforehand (herniation). If so, then place therein directly underneath that joint upon which reduction is desired —so the doctor's hand stands above it for placing on-site.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	Et sic quidem si returnerer tamen bene; et si non, strenchamente acquiesce ille ad apostema et attende illa sola ora che perisce l'avostram poena corporis, e non iteres aquo, qual solo se la reducere poterà in queste ore.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	Mighty joints according to their tortuous nature; and there is nothing in the body that causes them, but rather they are mollified and cannot cause any pain themselves anymore, for you wise ones understand that the nerves have been fractured or shattered, and it's not by chance but because of a specific purpose: to harden these joints through cauterization in order to remove some heat content.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	So when returning from fever or illness and there're painful spots that have been recommended, apply the treated paste to this area of your body for several days; also let it be drained by gravity and rubbed gently on its surface as well as massaged above with lubricant. Moreover, ensure that these are not saturated excessively or without care before they dry up too much after being cleaned off the affected skin areas (which have been used), while allowing time for rest; this helps maintain moisture and relieves discomfort from inflammation in those spots of your body.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	May if the patient's condition becomes immobile and starts to worsen with any slight movement due to some frostbite that has been in contact for a while, then gently warm those areas with cold water tailings and some colder vegetable waters until they are alleviated.

De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Chapter XXIX - On the Treatment of Dislocations.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	In some cases, I have completely dislocated them from all parts. The patient is in an extremely critical condition due to my negligence and the lack of proper precautions during surgery.

This line describes a treatment approach in which the individual who suffers from gout refrains from speaking or physical activity, preferring rest. They sleep on and off until their pain subsides.

E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg. E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	The minister holds the post firmly but does not bury it in a pit; another minister also takes care of the other following that manner.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu. Another minister holds another ligature wire over their legs according to plan and inserts it between them so as not to let out any intestine, holding onto both hands; then tighten all of these wires together firmly around the feet in such way they won't fall off under pressure or slippage. Adjust each band accordingly and tie those at a second post where his legs will be placed (around their chest).

If you want to work on the one which I revolved around myself; and since it is necessary that your cap of malady be overturned from its previous position at both ends by holding two staves, each as long as a forearm or so high above your head in between where a palm fits snugly - this movement turns the one which you wish to heal on itself and it is fixed firmly onto land so that it doesn't get lost.

And after the spondyl is returned to its place and positioned as discussed earlier, apply pressure on a heated poultice made of albumen mixed with herbs (this mixture should be kept warm), and dress it well; then pause until cool compresses are applied externally over that region. The bed must now accommodate the three-foot length or an equivalent amount to prevent rolling into sleep, which is when we apply these cold compresses on top of where the spondyl was located before treatment (and below this part afterward). It's important for healing and pain management in medieval medicine that not only do physical interventions take place but also home adjustments are made to ensure comfort during recovery. Here, albumen – a type of raw egg white commonly used at the time as an ointment base due to its purported therapeutic properties like cooling and strengthening capability when mixed with herbs for poultices or compresses—is utilized alongside restorative methods mentioned in these instructions.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	So that he may lie on his ligament which we have said before and place the malady within by introducing it through its subtle food for sustenance so that it can be cured. 
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	Even if there is some urgency in the location at bedtime for a cure, doctors who are administered medicines that moisten and cleanse as part of their care regimen over long periods of time have been recommended; and they receive it here with a layer of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	Sometimes urgent acutencies occur in the lower back of two spondyles (vertebrae), and this is caused by that dislocation; it's the one for which we have already taken measures to prevent puncturing, so as not to cause further harm with this medicine. If left untreated, such severe cases can lead to death.

De curacio de anca dislocada.	Treatment for the shoulder joint dislocation.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Doctors say that the joint between the shoulder and collarbone only causes displacement without necessarily having arthritis; it does not, however, cause pain to those areas where there are small bones or concave cavities in other parts of the body with similar conditions.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	The joint between the shoulder blade and collarbone is displaced according to four methods: it can be dislocated at or below its divisions, above these divisions, in front of them, or behind/behind those sections (rear).
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras. Mostly it is dislocated at certain parts of the body, and rarely in other joints or posterior ones when you adjust the bone misalignment back into its natural position by repositioning the malaligned tendon with care to avoid further injury as this realignment can sometimes cause pain. Ensure that your movements are gentle so that muscles surrounding the dislocation don't contract, making it difficult for proper healing and may lead to additional complications like a frozen shoulder if not managed carefully.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident. If the dislocation is in a limb's shoulder joint, here are actions to take: remove any objects that may cause further injury (e.g., clothing with constrictions) from both affected areas of body and immediate surroundings; ensure these items stay removed while treatment occurs for an hour or more until professional help arrives—or as best you can manage, provide temporary relief to minimize pain and immobilization during this time without causing additional harm.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	Stand the patient on their feet while applying pressure to areas near joints as I described previously for shoulder dislocations; then carefully support this limb in a way that helps it return into place, being cautious and gentle with each move—watch attentively until you see signs of successful repositioning before moving or adjusting the patient's position. If at any point there is increased pain, swelling, numbness, tingling, or loss of circulation to fingers/toes (or other sensations suggesting further injury), stop immediately and prepare for professional assessment as soon as possible. Remember this should only be attempted in life-threatening emergencies where a doctor is not immediately
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	E prepare to fast the patient' self for three days by placing a bowl at his feet which will make him stop feeding on himself; and secure that he not move during those times so they may be properly examined, with two caps affixed tightly around it—these are done in such a way as to strengthen its structure firmly over the course of three days. Afterward remove this bowl while making him rest from walking for some time until he is purified and restored through dietary means; once his health has been reestablished, thereafter secure it with assurance that all treatments have had their intended effect.

E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa. E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then you must work hard on it so that its reduction occurs in the common meeting of causes, thereby eliminating its humoral poison as a result.
